territory.notes: In 1764, the French established a naval base at Port Louis (East Falkland I./Isla Soledad); Islands named Ǐles Malouines by French mariner Louis-Antoine de Bougainville. The British claim to the Islands was established in 1765 by Royal Navy captain John Byron, who named the territory Falkland’s Islands. In 1770, Spain acquired the French claims to the islands. When Argentina declared its independence from Spain in 1816, it claimed the Falkland Islands as a successor to the Spanish claim. By 1833, British sovereign claim to the Islands was restablished with a new settlement and administration.
